name: NanoDSL Basic Evaluation Suite
description: Core test cases to evaluate AI model's ability to generate valid NanoDSL

testCases.name: Simple Greeting Card
testCases.description: Generate a basic greeting card with title and message
testCases.userPrompt: Create a simple greeting card with a hello title and welcome message

testCases.name: Product Display Card
testCases.description: Generate a product card with image, title, price, badge, and action button
testCases.userPrompt: Create a product card component that takes a Product item and displays: product image, title, 'New' badge if item is new, description (limited to 2 lines), price, and an 'Add to Cart' button

testCases.name: Interactive Counter
testCases.description: Generate a counter with state management and price calculation
testCases.userPrompt: Create a counter card component with count and price state. Show the total (count * price), and include minus/plus buttons to modify count, with an input field for direct count entry

testCases.name: Login Form
testCases.description: Generate a login form with email, password inputs and navigation
testCases.userPrompt: Create a login form component with email and password inputs, a Login button that calls /api/login, and a 'Sign Up' link that navigates to /signup

testCases.name: Todo Task List
testCases.description: Generate a task list with add/delete functionality and list rendering
testCases.userPrompt: Create a task list component that takes a list of Task items. Include an input to add new tasks, and render each task with a checkbox and delete button. Use a for loop to iterate over tasks

testCases.name: User Profile Card
testCases.description: Generate a user profile card with avatar, stats, and conditional badge
testCases.userPrompt: Create a user profile card that displays: avatar image, name, email, verified badge (if verified), bio text, follower/following counts, and an Edit Profile button

testCases.name: HTTP Request Contact Form
testCases.description: Generate a contact form with HTTP POST request submission
testCases.userPrompt: Create a contact form component with name, email, and message fields. Include a Send button that submits a POST request to /api/contact with the form data as JSON. Show loading state while submitting, display success message on success, and show error message on failure. Use proper HTTP headers for JSON content type.
